explanation: The new interval [8, 15] overlaps with [6, 10], [11, 12], and [13, 16]. These intervals merge to form [6, 16], and the result is [[1, 2], [3, 5], [6, 16]].
The new interval [2, 5] overlaps with [1, 2], [3, 4], and [5, 6]. Merging them results in [1, 6].
The new interval [15, 17] does not overlap with any existing intervals and is simply added at the end.
